RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 13800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STREET MAX stalked the leaders down the backside, rallied three wide to engage the pacesetters at the quarter pole, opened a clear advantage in upper stretch and was never threatened down the lane. WILDERZAR unhurried in the early going to be near the back of the field, swept up four wide on the turn to loom and finished willingly while unable to match the winner. EL BANDIDO trailed into the turn, commenced a steady advance in the turn and finished well to be gaining late. FROSTY PAWS sped up to duel on the lead from the fence to the head of the lane and weakened through the stretch. PAPA D L broke a step tardy to be at the rear of the field, rallied down the backside and through the turn to be in striking distance and flattened out turning for home. LEFTLANEOUTLAW pressed the pace dueling to the quarter pole from two wide and gave way in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Papa D L
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start, rallied turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Wilderzar
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, swept up 4w, willingly, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Street Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rally 3w, clear lead, not threatened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 9. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: J P'S GLADYS unhurried for the first quarter mile, circled three wide in the turn to engage the leader in upper stretch and drew off to the wire convincingly. KAY BEE GEE stalked the pace to the turn, assumed command with a four wide rally to open a clear advantage turning for home and was outkicked through the lane. PROSPERA dueled on the lead from two wide to the quarter pole and weakened in the stretch. BISCOTTINI slow early to trail, to the head of the lane and rallied mildly up the fence coming home. FLYING BUSINESS chased the leaders through the turn and failed to menace. ADULTING flashed speed to duel from three wide into the turn and lacked a response when called upon giving way in the lane. SWEET EMPIRE rushed up the rail to duel on the lead in the first quarter and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: J P's Gladys
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, circled 3w, took command, drew away

ENTRY.NAME: Kay Bee Gee
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid 4w, assumed command, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Adulting
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, through early, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 27500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR ENTERED TO BE CLAIMED FOR $25,000. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-wi nners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALWAYS LAUGHING tracked the pace from the rail down the backside, made a steady advance up the rail through the turn, tipped two wide nearing the quarter pole to engage the pacesetter and drew clear in the lane. DUNVEGAN DOLL well positioned between rivals entering the backstretch, lost position to be at the back of the field while patiently handled, saved ground through the final bend rallying up the rail, angled out in upper stretch and finished willingly. R THREE ANGELS set the pace while well rated down the backside, maintained the advantage to the quarter pole and lacked a response when engaged turning for home. CEVICHE prompted the pace to the far turn and flattened out coming home. PRINCESS HALIME went evenly without impact. HAPPY BEE caught wide through the first turn, raced up to a stalking spot down the backside and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: R Three Angels
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace, well rated, no response, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Always Laughing
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, steady advance, tipped out, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Dunvegan Doll
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost position, patient handling, saved ground, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Bee
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, caught wide, through early,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 70. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEECHI prompted the pace to the turn, assumed command on the bend, shook off challengers turning for home and drew clear in the lane. SPICE ICE broke a step slow to be near the rear, rallied along the fence cutting the corner at the top of the lane and closed well to gain the place. BODIL reserved off the leaders to the turn and made a mild rally through the stretch. MIZZEN THE POINT tracked the pace to the bend, rallied four wide through the turn to threaten at the quarter pole and flattened out in the lane. CHICA CHULA stumbled badly leaving the gate to be well behind the field and showed some late interest in the stretch. GO GIRL showed brief speed to be on the lead and was through early. MARGARITA CINCO well placed in the early going and fade through the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Spice Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, unhurried early, cut corner, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Mizzen the Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, early bid 4w, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Neechi
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, assumed command, shook clear, no doubt

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 17500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOUSEBUILDER tracked the pace to the turn, rallied five wide to engage the leaders in upper stretch and pulled clear late in a determined drive. TOYI well placed along the rail just off the pace, made a threatening bid while cutting the corner turning for home, drifted out in the lane and finished willingly while unable to keep pace with the winner. LITTLE VAQUERO stalked the pace to the turn, ranged up three wide between horses to challenge at the head of the lane and finished evenly while in tight down the lane. GOLD HERITAGE reserved off the leaders through the turn, angled wide in upper stretch and made a mild late rally. FAST FELIX slow early to trail and passed tiring rivals in the stretch. WARHORSE WEST pressed the pace to the quarter pole and weakened in the lane. AWESOME ENOUGH set the pace from the fence under pressure throughout and gave way coming home. ESTILO CLASICO was never a threat. THE STEWARDS POSTED AN INQUIRY IN REGARDS TO THE STRETCH RUN AND UPON REVIEW MADE NO CHANGE.

ENTRY.NAME: Toyi
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, inside bid, drifted out, dueled, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Little Vaquero
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid 3 wide, even late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 36200. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowanc es).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CONTROLLER stalked the pace to the far turn, assumed command into the bend opening a clear advantage to upper stretch, was engaged by stablemate and dueled to the wire gamely coming back to prevail by the shortest of margins at the wire. CASUAL ATTIRE tracked the leaders from three wide to the turn, rallied to mid-stretch to collar the leader, battled with that one to the wire and was denied by a nostril on the head bob. KNOCK WOOD reserved off the pace to the top of the lane and ground out the show placing. HITE slow early to trail and passed tiring rivals in the lane. WETZEL chased the leaders into the turn mounting a four wide rally into contention and flattened out in the drive. INTO GOLD sped to the lead opening a clear lead and stopped midway on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Knock Wood
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, grinding close, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Wetzel
ENTRY.OWNER: Pickerrell William D Pickerrell Joe and Cline Robert C
ENTRY.COMMENT: early bid 4w, long drive, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Casual Attire
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3w, rallied turn, stretch duel, denied, lost bob

ENTRY.NAME: Controller
ENTRY.OWNER: Blazing Meadows Farm LLC and Ella D Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, assumed command, duel, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEXT GENERATION squeezed at the start to be taken up and trail early, made a steady advance leaving the three-eighths pole, angled to the clear five wide in upper stretch and finished well to be up in time. SEEYOUINMOTOWN unhurried in the early going, rallied four wide through the turn to engage the pacesetter in mid-stretch, took command inside the eighth pole and was caught in deep stretch. THE MIRACLE KIUT broke outward start, sped to the lead to have a comfortable advantage through the turn and tired down the lane. KAT TRAX pressed the pace to the top of the stretch and weakened in the drive. SUGAR LOVES IT pinched back at the start from between rivals, raced up the fence into the turn to be in contention and lacked a closing response. SORORITY SISTER stalked the pace from three wide to be prominent at the quarter pole and gave way in the stretch. KISS VALENTINA showed brief foot to be well placed and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: The Miracle Kiut
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, speed, clear lead, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Loves It
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched start, rallied up fence, no late response

ENTRY.NAME: Next Generation
ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed start, trailed, steady advance, up in time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 25900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered F oals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAINBOW'S PRIDE hustled up the fence to take the lead shortly from the gate, responded when challenged turning for home and cleared off in the drive impressively. QUARANTINO broke alertly, taken in hand to settle into stalking position three wide, rallied to threaten at the top of the stretch and finished willingly while no match for the winner. ATLANTIC VAQUERO tracked the pace to the turn, rallied three wide to loom boldly in upper stretch and was outkicked down the lane while clearly the best to the rest. NAPA DUDE slow early to trail and passed tiring rivals in the lane. AURA OF GOLD failed to menace. DUKE OF FENWAY was never a threat. ESTILO FAVORITO pressed the pace for three-eighths and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Rainbow's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled inside, set pace, repelled challengers, clear

ENTRY.NAME: Quarantino
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly, settled, bid, no match
